feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: In a World of Uncertainty, How Does SAP Help Leaders Stay Ahead?
entry.content:
In a World of Uncertainty, How Does SAP Help Leaders Stay Ahead?

Crisis Becomes the New Normal

Global supply chains wobble. Regulation and compliance demands increase. Markets change overnight. For CEOs, CTOs and CHROs, this shift demands fast action, not slow response.

SAP Tools Designed for Change

SAP helps leaders stay ready through:

  • Integrated data and systems: With SAP, different systems—finance, supply chain, HR—link up so decision-makers see the full picture.
  • Real-time insight: Data flows into dashboards fast, so leaders don’t wait for end-of-month reports.
  • Embedded intelligence and automation: AI and smart tools inside SAP solutions help reduce manual work and highlight key trends.

Why This Matters to the C-Suite

Speed, clarity and resilience matter. With reliable data, leaders make faster, more confident decisions. Connected systems and smart tools help organizations bounce back from disruption. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

Practical Leadership Scenarios

  • A CFO sees live cash-flow changes during a supply-shock and adjusts strategy next day.
  • A COO uses SAP tools to switch suppliers automatically when risk levels spike.
  • A CHRO identifies staffing gaps across regions via unified HR and operations data.

Key Actions for Leaders

To thrive in uncertainty:

  • Focus on data alignment — ensure every function shares the same definitions and metrics.
  • Build governance — with uncertainty comes risk, so traceability and control matter.
  • Promote a culture of agility — teams must adapt quickly, empowered by insights not held back by tools.

Conclusion

Change isn’t slowing down; it’s speeding up. For leaders to succeed, the right systems matter as much as the right mindset. SAP provides the backbone. But it’s leadership that turns insight into impact.

Soft CTA:
If you’re exploring how your organization can build resilience with SAP solutions, join peer discussions in the SAP Community or connect with experts who are navigating change every day.

entry.title: GRPO Remains Open Even Though Item Quantities, Freight and A/P Invoice Fully Match.
entry.content:
We are experiencing an issue where a Goods Receipt PO (GRPO) remains in Open status even though the document flow is fully completed. The related A/P Invoice was created using Copy From → GRPO or Copy To → GRPO, and all item quantities and freight values match exactly. The payment is also fully applied to the A/P Invoice. Despite this, the GRPO does not close automatically.

Please let me know why the GRPO is not auto-closing despite 100% matching item quantities and freight values.

Find the image of the relationship map for your reference.

entry.title: what is the the field GTSRegNum in OCRD
entry.content: In Business partner list window, GTSRegNum field can select. But Which information is store in this field. On Which tab,it is appear in Business partner UI screen ?

entry.title: Crystal report not supressing empty sub-report
entry.content:
I have a subreport reading 3 fields form a database. The contents of those fields are as following:

Field LOT

 displayed as:

'LOT: ' + {BatchNumbers.BatchNum}

suppressed on:

{BatchNumbers.BatchNum} = "" OR ISNULL({BatchNumbers.BatchNum})

 Field EXP

Displayed as:

{BatchNumbers.MHD Text} + ' ' + CSTR(YEAR({BatchNumbers.ExpDate}),0,'') + '-' + CSTR(MONTH({BatchNumbers.ExpDate}), '00',0)

suppressed on:

{BatchNumbers.BatchNum} = "" OR ISNULL({BatchNumbers.BatchNum})

Field Quantity

Displayed directly, suppressed on:

{BatchNumbers.Gesamtmenge} = {BatchNumbers.Quantity}

That is the whole subreport, it is set in the main report to be suppressed if empty. However, that does not work; I still get the subreport-area in the main report. How can I get rid of it?

entry.title: Request for Access to Inventory Aging Report for Limited Financial License Users
entry.content:
Dear Team,

It has come to our attention that the Inventory Aging Report is currently inaccessible under the Limited Financial license in SAP Business One. As this report resides within the Inventory/Logistics module, it falls outside the scope of the Limited Finance license capabilities.
However, this report is critical for monitoring stock movement and supporting month-end reconciliation activities. Given its relevance to financial operations, we believe Limited Financial users should be granted access to it.
Could you please advise on the possibility of enabling access or suggest an alternative approach to ensure these users can retrieve the necessary inventory aging data?

Regards,

entry.title: How do I connect a custom tables field with a system tables column?
entry.content: I created a custom table. Now I want to connect one of the tables column with the table OLNG, but it is not in the list. How can I do this?

entry.title: Document Data Matching in Electronic Document Import Wizard
entry.content:
Hi,

When importing A/P Invoices electronically, we sometimes have invoices with hundreds of lines. We might have multiple GRPO's for the one invoice in this case. We need to be able to select multiple GRPO's at the header level. At present we can only select one base GRPO for an invoice and then we have to select the other GRPO at every individual line which is very time consuming. How can we select multiple GRPO's at the header level?

Thanks!

entry.title: How does the Inventory Audit Report calculation work in SAP Business One?
entry.content:
Hello!

I am studying in depth how SAP Business One calculates and “freezes” quantities and values in the Inventory Audit Report.

I would like to understand what happens behind the scenes, specifically:

1. How does SAP “lock” the quantity on a past date?
When I generate the report for a specific date (for example: 2024-10-30), it returns exactly the quantity I had in each warehouse on that date.

I would like to understand:

Which tables and fields does SAP use to reconstruct this historical stock balance?

Does it recalculate everything transaction by transaction, or is there any kind of snapshot?

Is there a table that stores frozen quantities, or is everything derived from historical documents only?

2. How does the system determine which items to include?
Does it include all items that had movements before the selected date?

Or only items with a non-zero balance?

entry.title: SAP B1 Boyum P&D Config
entry.content:
Hi team, 

Hope you are well. I wanted to reach out to understand configuration for Boyum B1 UP / B1 Print & Delivery. 
So our implementation partner assigned and set up Boyum for our group database. Now this group database is comprised of SAP B1 10.0 + Computec Add On (Process Force + WMS+PDC) And ofcourse Boyum B1 UP and P&D. 
We want to have similar set up except computec add on in another database in the same instance. However, when trying to configure the boyum add on in that, there is discrepancy within the menu items of what i can see in the Group DB vs the new db. 
Unsure how i can utilize the reports that are in the group db to the other db? 
Or how can i set up boyum to utilize them please?

entry.title: SAP B1 Emailer - Attachement is not adding in email when send the AR Invoice Email
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We are facing an issue with the SAP Business One mailer. When attempting to send documents (such as AR Invoice, Delivery, Purchase Order, etc.) via email, the system sends the email successfully, but the PDF/attachment is not getting added.

Issue Details:

Email is sent, but the attachment is missing.

The PDF preview works inside SAP (if applicable), but the final email contains no attachment.

This issue is occurring consistently for all/selected users (mention as applicable).

Actions Already Checked:

Email configuration in Administration → System Initialization → General Settings → Services

  • SMTP settings verified

  • Printer selection/output type configured

  • User email settings verified

entry.title: mass upload Batch Numbers in Goods Receipt PO
entry.content:
Hi All

Is there a function for Batch / Serial Number upload into SAP in PD (Goods Receipt PO) module?

Our client often has 1120 batch no every month, 600 batch no every two weeks, just to create just 1 pd for 663 different batch no. will take 1.5hr to do.

 

Kedalene Chong

entry.title: Remote Support Platform Backup Error Hana Client Not Found
entry.content:
During the scheduled Remote Support Platform (RSP) backup process, the system is showing an error stating. 

SAP HANA Client not found. This issue is occurring repeatedly and is impacting our regular backup operations.

The RSP backup should run smoothly without any dependency errors, and the system should detect the SAP HANA Client correctly to complete the backup as per schedule.

attached screenshot with this

entry.title: How to work with retentions in SAP Business one - AR invoice
entry.content:
Hello , 

im trying to apply the Retention on the AR invoice by following SAP note 1378837 - How to work with retentions?

https://me.sap.com/notes/1378837

i have apply the solution , but while posting the invoice , it's splitting the receivable amount into to lines with same account which is customer receivable account .

the requirments that how can i post the retention amount to another GL account not same as customer Receviable account .

 

thanks in advance 

 

 

Regards.

September below is showing for this JE

October it is empty despite us trying various methods

Thank you

entry.title: Import Fixed Assets: Choose series of Item Number
entry.content:
Hello folks.

I'm importing fixed asset data and wish to choose a series for the item number.  I've prepared some series but the importing chooses the "manual" automatically.  How can I specify the series like ALM in the picture below?

Thank you for your support in advance.

entry.title: Import Fixed Assets: What value APC should take?
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I put original cost in APC when I imported a fixed asset item.  But it doesn't seem right.  In the case below, The original price was 109,055 MXN and the remaining life is 32 months out of 120 months.  NBV only reflects the depreciation of this year.  Should I put 290,813.33 MXN that is 32/120 as the APC?

Thank you for your support in advance.

entry.title: AD Users are not bound with Users
entry.content:
We have cloud environment deployed with Cloud Control Center for SAP Business One.

Currently on version: PL21

After upgrading to PL21 the single signon is not working.

I noticed under User Management, Mapped AD User field is blank.

 

All the SLD agents are online, also this worse Woking in PL20.

Additionally we cant use DTW, after login it shows error "There is no company database in the server."

entry.title: Negative cost amount in Landed Cost in SAP B1
entry.content:
My customer is using SAP Business one 10  HANA  (FP2508).

For business reason, they have requirement to input negative amount in Landed cost, so decrease the amount of the imported materials. 

I tried but failed and got the message that In "Actual Customs" field, enter amount equal to or greater than 0 .     In Google and ChatGPT,  show that negative amount input is Ok. 

Is there any setup steps to enable this negative amount input in Landed cost?  or  It is not allowed in SAP B1 ?

entry.title: Invalid UOM Group after upload Item through DTW
entry.content:
Dear Team,

After uploading items through DTW, the items are getting uploaded successfully but showing an invalid UOM group. Please note that the group is set as the default and updated as manual, and it reflects correctly in that case. There is only one UOM group in the system.

Please guide on the same.

entry.title: Process Journal Entries to SAP B1 via Service Layer
entry.content:
We would like to ask for guidance regarding the most efficient method to post approximately 100,000 Journal Entry records into SAP Business One.

We are evaluating different approaches (Worker Service , Read from SQL , Build JSON AND Post Service Layer)
